title: Backend Engineer - Discovery (BD 1220)
description:
At Skroutz, we have a vision to make everyone's life better by building the most trustworthy, trouble-free, and easy to use online discovery and shopping experience. We want to provide this experience not only to our users and partners, but also to our team members.
We believe that people drive our business forward and we strive daily to build a powerful team that shares the same passion and enthusiasm for eCommerce and technology.

The Discovery team is responsible for shaping the product discovery experience for all users. We help users navigate and filter through millions of products in thousands of categories and assist them in figuring out how their specific needs will be met. To be successful, we have to translate the optimal user experience to a technological product, designing and implementing multiple experiments along the way. Our systems must be fast and reliable, often supporting more than 100k requests per minute.

We are looking for Software Engineers with a strong technical background and interest in building successful products and systems. You will be part of a small, talented and motivated team, tackle hard problems and improve the experience of millions of customers.

Examples of work you might undertake

  • Create the infrastructure to support the specific UX needs of each product category, whether it is fashion, home furniture or technology
  • Assist in the development of an excellent book shopping experience
  • Implement and maintain the best product reviewing system in the industry
  • Create or improve complex product filtering mechanisms such as sizes or colours
  • Run experiments and track several metrics to measure success
  • Maintain a software stack that serves millions of requests per day
requirements:
Your skills and experience

  • Solid algorithmic and software engineering background
  • Solid understanding of web architecture
  • Very good knowledge of at least one programming language. We work mostly in Ruby, but we believe that languages can be learned; we care much more about your general engineering skills
  • Very good knowledge and understanding of SQL and database systems
  • Passion for readable, maintainable, testable, scalable and performant code
  • Ability to navigate around a relatively large existing codebase and cooperatively improve it through code reviews
  • Experience with a version control system (preferably Git) and a CI workflow
  • Team spirit and easy going attitude

title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer - Core Infrastructure (SRE 1220)
description:
At Skroutz, we have a vision to make everyone's life better by building the most trustworthy, trouble-free, and easy to use online discovery and shopping experience. We want to provide this experience not only to our users and partners, but also to our team members.
We believe that people drive our business forward and we strive daily to build a powerful team that shares the same passion and enthusiasm for eCommerce and technology.

What we are looking
We are looking for Site Reliability Engineers to join our Core Infrastructure SRE team! Our team lies right at the heart of Skroutz, making sure our services are always up and running, as a leading e-commerce platform should do.

From your role, you'll be working together with a group of people that sets up, scales and operates the infrastructure which supports skroutz.gr and the systems that surround it. Our infrastructure is self-managed, and we run everything from bare-metal servers and virtual machines to network switches and routers. We operate at around ~500 hosts spanning 3 physical locations and running various workloads including virtualization, load balancing, databases, caching, storage, monitoring, and so on! We are passionate about free software and that’s why we chose to run Debian GNU/Linux everywhere, even on our core routers(!), always looking for ways to contribute back to the community.

As a Sr. SRE, we want you to bring a developer's mindset to system administration by looking for ways to automate our manual work and scale our systems to meet tomorrow’s needs; to help us expand our infrastructure by considering and mitigating all possible things that could go wrong, before they do, by focusing on openness, reliability and performance.
requirements:
For this role we are looking for experienced candidates who are proficient with the Linux stack, familiar with networking concepts, and have a good background in software engineering and infrastructure automation scripting; we use Python extensively and Go where we find it more suitable. We definitely don’t expect you to know all our systems from day one, our team will be there to answer all the questions and guide you on our infrastructure and the technologies we use. You might have a CS or an equivalent engineering degree, but you might not. This is definitely not among our top priorities; having prior working experience on high-throughput systems with high availability demands is mainly what we are interested in and not how you get there.

Below there’s a list of items which you don't need to possess completely, but mostly cover the tools you’ll need for the work you’ll be mainly assigned.

Your Skills and Experience

  • More than 5 years managing Linux server infrastructures.
  • In-depth understanding of Linux systems.
  • Strong programming skills in at least one programming language such as Python, Go or Ruby.
  • Experience in deploying, managing, and using observability tools such as Prometheus, Grafana and the ELK stack.
  • Experience with web services (load balancing, HTTP, TLS); we use HAProxy, Varnish, and Nginx.
  • Working knowledge of a configuration management system like Puppet, Ansible, and Chef.
  • A sense of self-drive and solution-oriented attitude; is something broken? You can't help it unless you fix it!
  • Ability to debug, optimize code, and automate routine tasks.
  • Effective communication and written skills with a strong tendency to "document as you go"

We will appreciate if you have

  • Good knowledge of the Linux networking stack (netfilter, policy routing, advanced interface types)
  • Some experience managing bare-metal hardware (PXE boot, working hands-on with computer hardware)
  • Experience with Docker in a production environment including container orchestration (e.g. Kubernetes, Mesos, Nomad, etc)
  • Personal projects or any shareable open source contributions which will help us during the evaluation process


Examples of work you might undertake

Here are some things we’ve worked on recently that might give you a better sense of what you’ll be doing day to day:

  • Maintain the infrastructure and services used by skroutz.gr and the systems that surround it.
  • Improve the monitoring and visibility of our stack (services, networking, hosts), enhance our Prometheus Monitoring system and build new exporters and metrics for it.
  • Design, setup, and execute the migration plan to our next generation of bulk storage pools using Ceph.
  • Revamp our automated OS provisioning to make it more reliable and support newer OS releases.
  • Maintain and be responsible for the upkeep and expansion of our datacenter infrastructure; this typically includes physical presence and working hands-on with computer hardware.

Technologies you'll work with

  • Debian Linux for our 500+ hosts (bare metal, VMs, and routers)
  • Ganeti and Qemu for virtualization
  • Puppet CE for configuration management and Ansible for switches
  • Haproxy, Varnish, Nginx
  • MariaDB, Elasticsearch, MongoDB, Redis, Druid
  • Keepalived, BGP, OSPF
  • Python, Go, Bash
  • Kafka, Openstack Swift, and (soon) Ceph for storage
  • ELK stack, Prometheus, Grafana, Icinga, Munin, Graphite and StatsD for observability
  • Juniper QFX and EX-series network switches

We believe that people drive our business forward and we strive daily to build a powerful team that shares the same passion and enthusiasm for eCommerce and technology.

We are looking for DevOps Engineers to join our Service Foundations team and help us achieve our goals! Our team lies right at the heart of Skroutz, making sure that developers work as efficiently as possible, the way a leading e-commerce platform should do.

We have about 150 software engineers with plans to grow even more. We deploy new code more than 15 times a day just on our main website (skroutz.gr) and new changes can reach production as fast as 20 minutes with all tests run. Each team has its own staging cluster and each developer has access to his own personal datastores with anonymized data, updated daily. We support and develop various tools and microservices in Ruby, Python and Go, that facilitate internal development and business needs. We are passionate about free software and strive to give back to the community.

From your role, you'll be tasked to maintain and improve on our testing, integration and deployment services and infrastructure. As a DevOps Engineer we want you to help us in automating trivial tasks, improving our deployment infrastructure, provide a solid foundation for migrating to container based deployments and provide a complete and trouble-free experience for the developers.
requirements:
For this role we are looking for experienced candidates who are proficient with Linux administration, container concepts/technologies, deployment pipelines, packaging, familiar with networking concepts, and have a good background in software engineering and infrastructure automation scripting; we use Python, Ruby, and Go where we find it more suitable.

We definitely don’t expect you to know all our systems from day one, our team will be there to answer all the questions and guide you on our infrastructure and the technologies we use.

You might have a CS or an equivalent engineering degree, but you might not. This is definitely not among our top priorities; having prior working experience on high-throughput systems with high availability demands is mainly what we are interested in and not how you got there.

What we expect you to have

  • 3 or more years as a DevOps Engineer/SRE.
  • Experience with building containerized applications for production environments
  • Experience building and operating CI/CD pipelines (e.g. using Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, GitHub Actions)
  • Strong programming skills in at least one programming language such as Python, Go, or Ruby.
  • Familiar with configuration management systems like Puppet, Ansible, or Chef.
  • A sense of self-drive and solution-oriented attitude; is something broken? You can't help it unless you fix it!
  • Ability to debug, optimize, and automate routine tasks.
  • Ability to work as part of a team, participating in code reviews, sharing knowledge and helping the other team members.
  • Effective communication and writing skills with a strong tendency to "document as you go"

We will appreciate if you have

  • Knowledge of the Linux networking (Netfilter, IP-route) and container fundamentals (cgroups, namespaces)
  • Experience managing Kubernetes clusters
  • Experience running services on public clouds (EC2, Azure, GCP)
  • Understanding of large web service architectures (load balancing, HTTP/2, TLS)
  • Experience using observability tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, and the ELK stack.
  • Personal projects or any shareable open source contributions which will help us during the evaluation process

Examples of work you might undertake

As a member of our Service Foundations team, you will take part in the team’s day-to-day tasks, as well as in some long-term projects. You might find yourself:

  • Maintaining the CI/CD infrastructure and services used by our developers.
  • Migrating our legacy custom CI/CD pipeline to a modern (container-based) one.
  • Implementing a modern, unified deployment workflow across all our services.
